title: Drop-down menu not offering options to make selection
content:
Hi,

I'm having a really strange problem.

I'm using Firefox on WIN 11 with my new LG laptop.

When I access a website's drop-down menu, it does not offer me options that I can make a selection.

I know that it's missing the 2 options - because when I try it on other PCs - it works fine. So the behaviour is different (and works) on other computers.

And the stranger thing is; it also does not offer the options when I tried it with Chrome and Edge.

I tried clearing the history and cache - and it still gives the same behaviour.

I called the Tech Support of the website - and they said it's clearly a problem with my specific PC. I would tend to agree with them - because I can access their site without any issues on other PCs.

I can't figure out what's in common amongst the 3 browsers I tried on this LG laptop. The only thing I found in common is this laptop!

Any ideas - any thing I can try next? Really driving me nuts... Â :)

mjl

title: "Slideshows on websites drive me crazy. How can I disable them?" (old thread was locked)
content:
I wanted to add a comment to one of these two old unsolved threads[*], but they are locked. Someone at forums management wrongly thinks that "old" means "solved".

What I wanted to add is I found a partial solution:

Press F12 to open developer tools Click the Debugger tab if it is not already the default open On the right side there is a column with a Pause button at the top and the items Threads, Watch expressions, Breakpoints, XHR Breakpoints, Event Listener Breakpoints, then "Filter by event type".

You can directly click the pause button or check the Animation event type. The site will freeze but the downside is the look will turn greyish.

Does anyone know how to pause but keep the normal colors/contrast look of the site without fading to grey?

[*] https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1217548 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1322580
creator: firefox.sync17

title: Tab previews need tweeking
content: It's not a huge deal but annoying none the less. And hard to explain. When I hover over the Firefox logo in my taskbar, all my open web pages are shown in miniature, which is great. The problem is, each of those small pages is shown at the top of the respective page rather than the position where I was working within them. In other words, I can't just pass my mouse over one of the miniatures and see the page displayed in the position where I was working; all I see is the top of that webpage. To get back to the spot where I had been working, I must actually click on the miniature and go back to that page. When I do, it opens correctly, exactly at the spot where I left it. But this means I have to click on each page to see where I was. So if I have 6 or 8 web pages open, and want to get a quick glance at any one of them, I have to hover then click on the page and go to it. I guess I got spoiled by the way Yahoo used to work; when I hovered over any of the miniatures, I was looking at the location on that page where I was working. I didn't have to actually click on the page to get a quick look. Hope this is making sense. Is there a setting I can adjust?

title: Browser is pausing when pressing and holding the backspace key
content:
I have experience and received multiple reports from users that when pressing and holding the "backspace key" in a input field on a website that the browser is pausing anywhere from 3 to 8 seconds.

I reviewed tickets for the last year and this started showing up about 8 months ago and it has gotten worse over time. I manage hundreds of users and most have stop using the browser because of this problem. The browser.backspace_action is set to 2 for all of the users.

Sites I have received multiple reports about are Twitter.com, Facebook and Instagram. Other sites like portal.azure.com, portal.microsoft.com and mozilla.org.

I have experienced it a lot even when entering this ticket.

Operating systems effected are Windows 10, 1903-21h2, Windows Server 2016, 2019, 2022 Standard/Datacenter fully patched and updated.

Anti-virus install on the machines are BitDefender, SentinelOne, and Microsoft Defender AV.

Firewalls range from SonicWall, Fortinet, WatchGuard and Cisco ASA, which are all up to date and patch.

Java is at its latest version when I check after receiving a report from a user.

Bandwidth to the internet is 100mb to 2gb.

I have tried disabling all extensions and the problem still occurs.

Needless to say but the browser is always at the latest version when I check.

creator: waseemalitaheem364

title: The Windows 10/11 on screen keyboard has been broken in Firefox if Taskbar is set to "auto-hide" FOR YEARS!!!!
content:
Basically the subject line. Ever since sometime in 2020, the Windows 10/11 on screen keyboard has been COMPLETELY broken in Firefox if the Windows Taskbar is also set to "automatically hide"! If a text entry box is selected, the keyboard will pop up for less than a second and then disappear.

Now in W10 the on screen keyboard is only broken in Firefox if in "tablet mode", but as that's the "only display mode" available in W11 it's COMPLETELY & UTTERLY broken in the newer OS!!! This means that while a workaround "fix" exists for W10 by changing the on screen keyboard's settings to have the same behavior in tablet mode as in desktop mode, in W11 the ONLY WAY to make the keyboard WORK AT ALL is to turn off Taskbar auto-hiding, which is simply UNACCEPTABLE on small screen devices!!!

And this has been broken and reported to you guys COUNTLESS TIMES for literally FREAKING YEARS at this point!!! Do you need a patch from Microsoft or something to fix this bug, because this is getting freaking absurd at this point...

I've been a diehard Firefox user for literally DECADES at this point, but I WILL LEAVE if this doesn't ACTUALLY get fixed in the near future!!!
